data.kor: 앞으로 보실 영화는 출애굽기를 각색한 것입니다.
data.eng: The motion picture you are about to see is an adaptation of the Exodus story.
While artistic and historical license has been taken,

data.kor: 우리는 이 영화가 이야기의 본질에 입각하여,
data.eng: we believe that this file is true to the essence,

data.kor: 전세계 수많은 사람들의 초석이 되는 가치와 진실성을 유지한 것이라 믿습니다.
data.eng: values and integrity of a story that is a cornerstone of faith for millions of people worldwide.

data.kor: 모세의 이야기는 출애굽기에서 찾을 수 있습니다.
data.eng: The biblical story of Moses can be found in the book of Exodus.

♪ I pray we'll meet again ♪

data.kor: ♪ 이제는 무사할 거야 그곳이라면 무사할 거야 ♪
data.eng: ♪ You're safe now and safe may you stay ♪
♪ For I have a prayer just for you ♪
♪ Grow baby brother ♪

♪ Come and deliver us too ♪
Mommy!

data.kor: 이리 오렴, 람세스. 파라오께 네 남동생을 보여 드리자꾸나-
data.eng: Come, Rameses. We will show Pharaoh your new baby brother-
Moses.
♪ Deliver us ♪
♪ Send a shepherd to shepherd us ♪
♪ And deliver us ♪
♪ To the Promised Land ♪
♪ Deliver us ♪
♪ To the Promised ♪
♪ Land ♪
♪ Deliver us ♪
Faster, you beasts!
You run like mules.

data.kor: 이봐, 람세스, 벽에다 얼굴을 박아줄까? / 나중에, 그래.
data.eng: Hey, Rameses, how'd you like your face carved on a wall? / Someday, yes.
How about now?
You almost killed me!
Oh, come on. Where's your sense of fun?
Oh, it's fun you want?
Moses?
Come on, you. Whoa!

data.kor: 어서, 모세. 인정해. 항상 날 우러러 봤잖아.
data.eng: Come on, Moses. Admit it. You've always looked up to me.

data.kor: 맞아, 근데 그다지 좋아 보이지도 않더라고.
data.eng: Yes, but it's not much of a view.
Hey!
Second born, second place. / Not for long.
Jump!
You don't think we'll get in trouble for this, do you?
No, not a chance.

data.kor: 어째서 신은 나에게 이런 무모하고 난폭한 데다 불경스럽기까지 한 아들을 보내 날 괴롭히시는 거지?
data.eng: Why do the gods torment me with such reckless, destructive, blasphemous sons?
Father, hear what I- / Be still!
Pharaoh speaks.
I seek to build an empire,

data.kor: 너희들은 오로지 즐거움을 위해서 죄다 난장판으로 만들어놨더구나.
data.eng: and your only thought is to amuse yourselves by tearing it down.
Have I taught you nothing?

data.kor: 폐하를 탓하지 마십시오. 폐하는 훌륭하신 스승이십니다.
data.eng: You mustn't be so hard on yourself, Your Majesty. You're an excellent teacher.

data.kor: 아드님이 아무것도 배우지 못한 것은 폐하의 잘못이 아니죠.
data.eng: It's not your fault your sons learned nothing.
Well, they learned blasphemy. / True.
Father, the fault is mine.

data.kor: 제가 형을 선동했습니다, 그러니 제 책임입니다.
data.eng: I goaded Rameses on, and so I am responsible.
Hmm. Responsible.

data.kor: 책임이 무슨 뜻인지는 알고 있느냐, 람세스?
data.eng: And do you know the meaning of that word, Rameses?
I understand, Father.

data.kor: 네가 태어나면서부터 지워진 너의 과업도 알고 있고?
data.eng: And do you understand the task for which your birth has destined you?
The ancient traditions.
When I pass into the next world,

data.kor: 네가 아침과 저녁의 별이 될 것이다.
data.eng: then you will be the morning and evening star.

data.kor: 고작 사원 하나 무너졌다고 수 세기 동안 내려오던 전통이 사라지는 건 아닙니다.
data.eng: One damaged temple does not destroy centuries of tradition.

data.kor: 하지만 약한 고리 하나 때문에 위대한 왕조의 사슬이 무너질 수도 있다!
data.eng: But one weak link can break the chain of a mighty dynasty!
You have my leave to go.
Father.
Father?
You know it was really my fault.
Must you be so hard on him?

data.kor: 모세, 너는 그 짐을 짊어지지 않아도 된다...
data.eng: Moses, you will never have to carry a burden...
...like the crown I will pass to Rameses.

data.kor: 람세스는 아무리 유혹해도 거기에 빠져들어선 안 돼,
data.eng: He must not allow himself to be led astray,

data.kor: 설령 그것이 너라 하더라도 말이다, 아들아.
data.eng: not even by you, my son.

data.kor: 형은 그저... 아버지의 인정을 받고 싶은 것뿐이에요.
data.eng: All he cares about is... is your approval.

data.kor: 분명 아버지의 기대에 부끄럽지 않게 할 거예요.
data.eng: I know he will live up to your expectations.
He only needs the opportunity.
Maybe. Maybe so.

data.kor: 가보거라. 오늘 밤에 너희 둘을 보도록 하마.
data.eng: Go now. I shall see you both tonight.
Well, that went well. / Just go away.
Could have been worse.
“The weak link in the chain.” That's what he called me.

data.kor: 뭐, 더 정확히 하자면 한심하다는 거지.
data.eng: Well, you are rather pathetic.
Irresponsible, ignorant of the traditions.
He practically accused me of bringing down the dynasty.
Yeah, I can see it now. There go the pyramids!
You can laugh about it.

data.kor: 조각상이 깨지고 넘어지고. 나일 강이 말라버리고.
data.eng: Statues cracking and toppling over. The Nile drying up.

data.kor: 혼자서, 잘도 지구 상 가장 위대한 왕국을 무너뜨리겠다.
data.eng: Single-handedly, you will manage to bring the greatest kingdom on Earth to ruin.
Tell me this, Moses. Tell me this.
Why is it that every time you start something,
I'm the one who ends up in trouble?
Ah, man!

data.kor: 람세스 왕자. 혼날 줄 아세요. / 람세스 왕자, 이리로 내려와요.
data.eng: Ah, it's Rameses. You're in trouble, young man. / Rameses, get down here!

data.kor: 우리한테 사과해야 할 것 같은데. / 이거 새건데!
data.eng: I think you owe us an apology. / Oh, my new thing!
I am so upset! / You might as well.

data.kor: 혼 좀 나셔야겠어요. / 파라오께 이를 겁니다!
data.eng: You'll pay for this. / We're gonna tell the Pharaoh!

data.kor: 오, 이것 봐. 오, 이것 좀 봐. 나 또 젖었어. / 있잖아, 뭔지 알겠다.
data.eng: Oh, look at me. Oh, look at me. I'm drenched again. / Hey. I figured it out.

data.kor: 형한테 뭐가 문제인 줄 알아? / 뭔데?
data.eng: You know what your problem is, Rameses? / What?

data.kor: 너무 예민하다는 거야. / 네 문제는, 무신경하다는 거고.
data.eng: You care too much. / And your problem is, you don't care at all.

data.kor: 오, 그러면, 형은 나보다 훨씬 더 신경을 더 많이 쓸 거란 소리네...
data.eng: Oh, in that case, I suppose you care a lot more than I do...

data.kor: ...예를 들면, 우리 지금 연회에 늦었다는 거에.
data.eng: ...that we're late for the banquet, for example.
I'm done for. Father will kill me.
Don't worry.

data.kor: 아무도 눈치 못 챌 거야 우리 들어오는 거.
data.eng: Nobody will even notice us coming in.
“Nobody will even notice.”
The young princes.

data.kor: 람세스, 방금 막 네가 섭정을 명받았단다.
data.eng: Rameses, you were just named prince regent.

data.kor: 이제는 네가 모든 사원을 감독해야 해.
data.eng: You are now responsible for overseeing all the temples.
I suggest you get over there...
...and thank your father.
Apparently, Moses,
someone thought he...
...just needed the opportunity.
My lord Pharaoh.

data.kor: 대사제가 새로운 섭정자에게 공물을 바쳤으면 합니다.
data.eng: I propose that the high priests offer tribute to their new regent.
An excellent idea. Hotep! Huy!
Huy.

data.kor: 흠? / 그 미디안 여자. / 좋은 생각이야!
data.eng: Hmm? / The Midian girl. / That's a good idea!
Go get her.
By the power of Ra,

data.kor: 람세스 왕자님의 즐거움과 기쁨을 위해 이것을 바칩니다...
data.eng: we present for your delectation and delight...

data.kor: ...저 먼 곳에서 데려온 이국적이고 경이로운 것이죠.
data.eng: ...an exotic apparition stolen from a faraway land.
We offer you this delicate desert flower.

data.kor: 어디 여기 있는 사막의 꽃을... 좀 살펴볼까.
data.eng: Let us inspect this... desert flower.
More like a desert cobra.

data.kor: 뱀은 잘 못 부리는군, 안 그래?
data.eng: Not much of a snake charmer, are you?
That's why I give her to you.

data.kor: 아니, 아니야, 아니, 마음은 정말 고마운데... / 누구도 날 가질 수 없어.
data.eng: No, no, no, that's generous, but... / I won't be given to anyone.

data.kor: 특히나 오만하고, 응석받이에 버릇없는 녀석한테는 더더욱!
data.eng: Especially an arrogant, pampered palace brat!

data.kor: 계속 저런 식으로 지껄이게 내버려둘 거야?
data.eng: Are you going to let her talk to you like that?

data.kor: 이집트 왕자에게 합당한 예의를 갖추도록 하라.
data.eng: You will show the proper respect for a prince of Egypt.

data.kor: 너한테 갖춰야 할 예의 따위- 없어!
data.eng: But I am showing you all the respect you deserve- none!
No. Wait!
Be still. / Untie this rope!
I demand you set me free! / Be still. / Let me go!
As you wish.
You there!
Have her dried off...
...and sent to Prince Moses' chambers.
If it pleases you, Father,
my first act as regent is to appoint Moses...
...as royal chief architect.
Well-
Right.
Shh. Come on.
Guards.
Prince Moses.
Uh...
...there's a-a man tied up in my room.
Well, look into it. / Right away, sire.
Please, I need water.

data.kor: 갈 길이 멀답니다. / 신께서 당신과 함께 하시길.
data.eng: I have a long journey ahead of me. / May God protect you.
Thank you.

data.kor: 오. 오, 죄송해요. 정말 죄송합니다. 전-
data.eng: Oh. Oh, I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. I-
Oh, please forgive me. I-
I didn't expect to see... you...
here, of all places,
at-at-at our door.
Mmm, at last! / At last?
Didn't I tell you, Aaron? Didn't I tell you?

data.kor: 준비가 되면 우리한테 돌아올 줄 알고 있었어.
data.eng: I knew he would return to us when he was ready.
Miriam, do you want us flogged?

data.kor: 우리의 자유에 신경을 써줄 줄 알았어. / 미리암!
data.eng: I knew you cared about our freedom. / Miriam!
Freedom? Why would I care about that?
Because you're... well, you're our brother.
What? / Be-

data.kor: 그들이 말 안 해줬어? / 누가 뭘 말해줘?
data.eng: They never told you? / Who never told me what?

data.kor: 하지만 여기로 왔잖아. 알고 있어야 해. / 말 조심해, 노예 주제에!
data.eng: But you're here. You must know. / Be careful, slave!

data.kor: 오, 인정 많으신 왕자님. 음, 그-그녀가 오늘 하루 일이 힘들었나 봅니다.
data.eng: Oh, my good prince. Um, she's-she's exhausted from the day's work.

data.kor: 아, 일이 너무 많다는 건 아니고. 저희는...
data.eng: Uh, not that it was too much. We...
We quite enjoyed it.

data.kor: 그-그런데 헷갈려서 감히 어떤 분한테 말하고 있는 건지 잘 모르고 그런 겁니다.
data.eng: But-But she's confused and knows not to whom she speaks.

data.kor: 누구한테 말하고 있는 건지 알아, 아론. 네가 누군지 안다고.
data.eng: I know to whom I speak, Aaron. I know who you are.
And you are not a prince of Egypt. / Miriam.

data.kor: 뭐라 했지? / 전하, 그녀의 말에 신경쓰지 마십시오.
data.eng: What did you say? / Your Highness, pay her no heed.

data.kor: 가-가자, 미리암. 나랑 얘기 좀 하지? / 아니, 아론.
data.eng: C-Come, Miriam. May I discuss something with you? / No, Aaron.

data.kor: 아니! 제발, 모세, 믿어야 돼! / 그만해.
data.eng: No! Please, Moses, you must believe! / That's enough.
You were born of my mother, Yocheved.
Stop it. / You are our brother!
Now you go too far. You shall be punished.
No! Please, uh, Your Highness.

data.kor: 아파서 그래요. 몹시 아프거든요. 부디 너그럽게 봐주십시오.
data.eng: She's ill. She's very ill. We beg your forgiveness.

data.kor: 제발, 미리암, 가자. / 안 돼, 아론.
data.eng: Please, Miriam, let us go. / No, Aaron.

data.kor: 엄마가 널 살리려고 바구니에 담아서 강에 띄워 보냈어!
data.eng: Our mother set you adrift in a basket to save your life!
Save my life? From who?
Ask the man that you call “Father.”

data.kor: 어떻게 감히? / 신께서 널 우리의 구원자로 보내주셨어.
data.eng: How dare you? / God saved you to be our deliverer.

data.kor: 이제 됐다. / 그게 너야, 모세. 네가 우리의 구원자라고.
data.eng: Enough of this. / And you are, Moses. You are the deliverer.
I said, enough!
You will regret this night.
♪ Hush now my baby ♪
♪ Be still love Don't cry ♪
♪ Sleep as you're rocked ♪
♪ By the stream ♪
♪ Sleep and remember ♪
♪ My last lullaby ♪
♪ So I'll be with you ♪
♪ When you dream ♪
Did you see him? It's Moses.
♪ Gleaming in the moonlight ♪

data.kor: ♪ 상쾌하고 깨끗한 이곳 내가 그동안 알고 지낸 이곳 ♪
data.eng: ♪ Cool and clean and all I've ever known ♪
♪ All I ever wanted ♪
♪ Sweet perfumes of incense ♪
♪ And graceful rooms of alabaster stone ♪
♪ All I ever wanted ♪
♪ This is my home ♪
♪ With my father mother brother ♪
♪ Oh so noble Oh so strong ♪
♪ Now I am home ♪
♪ Here among my trappings and belongings ♪
♪ I belong ♪
♪ And if anybody doubts it ♪
♪ They couldn't be more wrong ♪
♪ I am a sovereign prince of Egypt ♪
♪ A son of the proud history that's shown ♪
♪ Etched on every wall ♪
♪ Surely this is all I ever wanted ♪
♪ All I ever wanted ♪
♪ All I ever ♪
♪ Wanted ♪
The Hebrews grew too numerous.
They might have risen against us.

data.kor: 아버지, 아버지가 하신 게 아니라고 말씀해주세요.
data.eng: Father, tell me you didn't do this.
Moses,
sometimes, for the greater good,
sacrifices must be made.
Sacrifices?
Oh, my son.
They were only slaves.
Moses?
Is this where you found me?
Moses, please try to understand.

data.kor: 그럼... 그럼 제가 생각했던 게 다,
data.eng: So... So everything I thought,
everything I am, is a lie.
No.

data.kor: 넌 우리의 아들이란다, 우린 널 사랑해.
data.eng: You are our son, and we love you.
Why did you choose me?
We didn't, Moses.
The gods did.
♪ This is your home my son ♪
♪ Here the river brought you ♪
♪ And it's here the river meant ♪
♪ To be your home ♪
♪ Now you know the truth love ♪
♪ Now forget and be content ♪
♪ When the gods send you a blessing ♪
♪ You don't ask why it was sent ♪
Last night, the gods granted me a vision.

data.kor: 난 고작 사원을 복원하려는 것이 아니다, 더 웅장하게 만들 것이다,
data.eng: I'm not merely going to restore this temple, I will make it more grand,

data.kor: 지금까지, 그리고 앞으로의 이집트 역사상 가장 훌륭한 기념비를 세울 것이다.
data.eng: more splendid than any other monument in upper or lower Egypt.
Get up!
Moses! Look.

data.kor: 운명이 우리를 예기치 못한 사고에서 좋은 기회로 이끌었어. / 일어나라고, 노인네야!
data.eng: Fate has turned our little misadventure into a great opportunity. / Get up, old man!
I know father will be so pleased-
Put your back into it!
Faster!
And this is just the beginning.

data.kor: 하얀 석회석으로 된 새로운 도시로 관문이 이어져,
data.eng: A gateway will open to an entire new city of white limestone,
more dazzling than the sun.
And here, a statue of Hapi.

data.kor: 말했지, 서두르라고! / ...아주 큰 기둥 두 개를 세우고.
data.eng: I said, hurry! / ... two great column halls.
Stop it! Somebody's got to stop this!

data.kor: 우리가 할 수 있는 건 없어.
data.eng: There's nothing that we can do.
Stop it.
Stop. Stop it!
Leave that man alone!
Moses!
Out of my way. Out of my way. Move!
Who did this?

data.kor: 저기 위에! 저 사람이요. 저 위에.
data.eng: Up there! It's him. Up there.
Moses!
Moses, what's going on? Moses!
Moses!
Moses! / Let me go!

data.kor: 안 돼, 잠깐만. / 무슨 일인지 다 봤잖아. 내가 사람을 죽였어.
data.eng: No, wait. / You saw what happened. I just killed a man.
But... We can take care of that.
I will make it so it never happened.

data.kor: 네가 무슨 말을 하든 내가 한 짓이 사라지진 않아.
data.eng: Nothing you can say can change what I've done.
I am Egypt, the morning and the evening star.

data.kor: 내가 밤이 낮이라 하면, 그렇게 쓰여질 거고,
data.eng: If I say day is night, it will be written,

data.kor: 너에 대해서도 내가 말하는 대로 될 거야.
data.eng: and you will be what I say you are.
I say you are innocent.

data.kor: 형이 말하는 건 중요하지 않아. 형은 이해 못 해.
data.eng: What you say does not matter. You don't understand.

data.kor: 난 더 이상 이곳에 있을 수 없어.
data.eng: I can't stay here any longer.
Moses! / No!

data.kor: 지금까지 내가 알고 있던 게 다 거짓이었어.
data.eng: All I've ever known to be true is a lie.

data.kor: 난 형이 알고 있는 그런 사람이 아니야.
data.eng: I'm not who you think I am.
What are you talking about?

data.kor: 한때 내가 “아버지”라고 부르던 사람한테 가서 물어봐.
data.eng: Go ask the man I once called “Father.”
Moses?
Please.
Good-bye, brother.
Moses!
Moses!
No.
Hey, wait.
Please.
What are you doing? Help!
Stop! / Let our sheep drink!

data.kor: 안 돼! / 우릴 그냥 두라고! 저리 가!
data.eng: No! / Leave us alone! Get away!
No way, no, hey!
Stop it!
My father's the high priest of Midian.
You're going to be in big trouble.
Hey, you.
Aren't these your camels?

data.kor: 안 돼, 안 돼! 안 돼, 안 돼!
data.eng: No, no! No, no!
Wait! / Wait, stop!
What are you girls doing?
We're trying to get the funny man out of the well.
Trying to get the funny man out of the well.
Well, that's one I've never heard before.
Oh, my. Oh, uh, don't worry down there!
We'll get you out. Hold on!
You.

data.kor: 저러니까 아빠가 결혼 못 할 거란 소리를 하는 거야.
data.eng: That's why Papa says she'll never get married.

data.kor: 이러실 필요 없어요. 숙녀분들, 제발요, 정말, 정말로-
data.eng: You don't have to do this. Ladies, please, I'm really, I'm really quite-
No, not there, please.

data.kor: 간지러워요. 숙녀분들, 이미 충분히 다 씻기셨어요.
data.eng: That tickles. Ladies, you've cleaned every inch of me.
Whoa, I... I was wrong.
Let me through. Let me through. I want to see him.
Ah! You are most welcome.
You should not be a stranger in this land.
You have been sent as a blessing.

data.kor: 오늘밤, 자네는 나의 귀빈이 될 걸세.
data.eng: And tonight, you shall be my honored guest.
My father, Jethro, High Priest of Midian.
Psst. Sit with me.
Um, all right.
Psst. Not yet.
Oh, sorry. / My children,

data.kor: 이 풍요로운 음식을 주신 것에 감사합시다.
data.eng: let us give thanks for this bountiful food.

data.kor: 그리고 이곳에 참석해준 이에게 감사를 표합시다...
data.eng: And let us also give thanks for the presence...

data.kor: ...오늘밤 함께 하는 것만으로도 충분히 명예로운, 이 용감한 젊은이에게.
data.eng: ...of this brave, young man whom we honor here tonight.
Please, sir, I wish you wouldn't.

data.kor: 살면서 명예로운 행동을 해본 적이 없습니다.
data.eng: I've done nothing in my life worth honoring.

data.kor: 우선, 자네는 이집트에서 내 딸, 십보라를 구해줬어,
data.eng: First, you rescue Tzipporah from Egypt,

data.kor: 그리곤 내 어린 딸들을 도둑들로부터 구해줬고.
data.eng: then you defend my younger daughters from brigands.
You think that is nothing?

data.kor: 내가 봤을 때 자네는 명예가 무엇인지 잘 모르는 것 같구먼.
data.eng: It seems you do not know what is worthy of honor.
♪ A single thread in a tapestry ♪
♪ Though its color brightly shine ♪

data.kor: ♪ 자기가 무엇을 뜻하는지 알 수 없지 ♪
data.eng: ♪ Can never see its purpose ♪
♪ In a pattern of the grand design ♪

data.kor: ♪ 저기 제일 꼭대기의 돌 한 조각도 ♪
data.eng: ♪ And the stone that sits on the very top ♪
♪ Of the mountain's mighty face ♪
♪ Does it think it's more important ♪
♪ Than the stones that form the base ♪

data.kor: ♪ 자신의 삶이 가치있는지 어떻게 알 수 있을까 ♪
data.eng: ♪ So how can you see what your life is worth ♪

data.kor: ♪ 네 자신의 가치 또한 어떻게 알 수 있을까 ♪
data.eng: ♪ Or where your value lies ♪

data.kor: ♪ 사람의 눈으로는 절대로 볼 수 없어 ♪
data.eng: ♪ You can never see through the eyes of man ♪
♪ You must look at your life ♪
♪ Look at your life through heaven's eyes ♪
Dance with me.
No, I don't know how.
♪ A lake of gold in the desert sand ♪
♪ Is less than a cool fresh spring ♪
♪ And to one lost sheep a shepherd boy ♪
♪ Is greater than the richest king ♪
♪ If a man lose everything he owns ♪
♪ Has he truly lost his worth ♪
♪ Or is it the beginning ♪

data.kor: ♪ 새롭게 빛나는 삶을 살 수도 있겠지 ♪
data.eng: ♪ Of a new and brighter birth ♪
♪ So how do you measure the worth of a man ♪

data.kor: ♪ 돈이나 힘 아니면 크기만으로 잴 수 있을까♪
data.eng: ♪ In wealth or strength or size ♪

data.kor: ♪ 가진 재산 나눠준 재산으로 잴 수 있을까 ♪
data.eng: ♪ In how much he gained or how much he gave ♪
♪ The answer will come ♪
♪ The answer will come to him who tries ♪
♪ To look at his life through heaven's eyes ♪

data.kor: ♪ 그것이 우리가 가진 것을 너와 함께 하는 이유야 ♪
data.eng: ♪ And that's why we share all we have with you ♪

data.kor: ♪ 비록 가진 게 얼마 안 되긴 하지만 ♪
data.eng: ♪ Though there's little to be found ♪
♪ When all you've got is nothing ♪

data.kor: ♪ 나눌 수 있는 게 더 많다네 ♪
data.eng: ♪ There's a lot to go around ♪

data.kor: ♪ 운명에서 도망갈 수 있는 삶은 없어 ♪
data.eng: ♪ No life can escape being blown about ♪

data.kor: ♪ 변화의 바람을 타고 기회의 바람을 타고 ♪
data.eng: ♪ By the winds of change and chance ♪

data.kor: ♪ 모든 것을 알 순 없겠지만 말이야 ♪
data.eng: ♪ And though you never know all the steps ♪
Dance with me.

data.kor: 아니, 그... 아니. 못 해! / ♪ 함께 춤추는 법을 배워야 해 ♪
data.eng: No, I... No. No! / ♪ You must learn to join the dance ♪
♪ You must learn to join the dance ♪
♪ So how do you judge what a man is worth ♪

data.kor: ♪ 그가 쌓아온 것 아니면 사놓은 것 ♪
data.eng: ♪ By what he builds or buys ♪

data.kor: ♪ 단순히 바라본다고 해서 볼 수 있는 것이 아니야 ♪
data.eng: ♪ You can never see with your eyes on earth ♪
♪ Look through heaven's eyes ♪
♪ Look at your life ♪
♪ Look at your life ♪
♪ Look at your life through heaven's eye ♪
